data.text: @sunilssihag @Reuters Of course. Many did not, but I did. I also happen to do a decent amount of business with UAE. You, I, and everyone else are fully entitled to shop in Iraq or not. But if UAE & India can’t choose justice over abstention then I can’t support those businesses or interests 🤷🏼
@Riiza311 @Reuters Naa. They only want their people to live like humans.
@Reuters And? They want to set another Guinness World Records or what?
@boycottbobble @Reuters People didn't stop visiting US after Iraq invasion, but you think they would stop visiting UAE for abstention in UN?
@undecidedmann @Reuters Because it’s the most sensible thing to do. The “vax” narrative has already collapsed
@Reuters Finally good sense prevail. With vaccination and reduction in cases, you have to let people live
@Reuters Who cares? No one is going to travel there after their UN abstention 🤷🏼 Get with the times @Reuters

@Reuters Hi! Babies have a comfortable day too.
https://t.co/yxibfp0QzS
